description: This course critically apraises the role the criminal justice system has played on the African-American experience, from Colonial time through the present. More specifically, the course examines African-Americans as offenders, victims, and workers in the criminal justice system. In addition, the various theories that have been offered to explain the over representation of African-Americans in the criminal justice system are reviewed and critiqued. Finally, the course expostulates the various strategies that have been used to address crime in the African-American community.
name: AF AMER, CRIME & JUSTICE
